lexUnit.name: stuff.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: force tightly into a receptacle or space.

sentence.text: And then Sally Gunnell talked to me about stuffing her gold medal in a cupboard at home .
She closed her eyes and stuffed her fingers in her ears .
` She told me , thank God , that she had to stuff a handkerchief in her mouth to stop laughing too loudly . "
He stuffed extra grenades in his pockets .
The car and the trucks accelerated into the night , the same night that concealed the sergeant as he stuffed the money in his pocket , telling himself that Rommel knew best .
James slid off the arm of the sofa and stuffed his hands in his trouser pockets .
Shamlou picked up the buff envelope and stuffed it in the pocket of his windcheater .
She rolled up her pyjamas and stuffed them under her pillow , before quickly pulling the bedclothes to .
He picked up a cockerel by its feet , stuffing it under his arm .
If an official representative of the Museum approaches , stuff your lunch under your jumper ! "
I heard Bernice coming just in time to fold the photocopies and stuff them inside my jacket .
He stuffed the scrawled pages into an envelope and sealed it .
` It 's all so long ago , " she added , stuffing more crisps into her mouth .
He stuffed the two pieces into Vasili 's anorak pocket .
I smiled cheerfully , wished everyone a good morning and began to stuff the food into my mouth .
Mary was stuffing wet towels into a dirty pillowcase .
He stared at her for a long moment , and then he turned , stuffed his hands into his trouser pockets , and stared out over the lake .
Here was a manhole down which to stuff the bodies .

Chemical apparatus tends to be broken , or reused in new arrangements ; but the historian may hope that even here laboratories may have had capacious cupboards into which unused pieces have been stuffed and thus preserved .
Off the back of the door he took an old net shopping-bag that his Mum hardly ever used and stuffed the carton and biscuits into it .
She collected up the letters and stuffed them back , higgledy-piggledy , into their brown paper and cardboard nest .
Chris had already been given a severe ticking-off when he 'd admitted to the box-office that he 'd lost count of the number of tickets and cheques he 'd stuffed into all his suit pockets .
In the event Mazzin was after the notebooks we 'd stuffed down the front of our pyjamas .
Both boys began stuffing the empty cases down their shirts .
So after this meal , when I find I 'm stuffing foul non-rancid things down my throat -- without bad effects -- I try a quick scuttle round the room .
Sally took the strip of paper and stuffed it down the front of her skirt .
